title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1:SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Output 3.1 By 2023, the Government of Lesotho has an improved child and gender-sensitive, shock-responsive social protection system., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluation, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3:By 2023, all children, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive social policies for the sustainable and equitable realization of their rights.

participating-org.narrative: FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS
MINISTRY OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND CHIEFTAINSHIP

sector.narrative: Connecting cash transfers to information, knowledge and services
Expanding and improving cash transfers for children
Field Monitoring including humanitarian performance monitoring
Improved and integrated social proteciton data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Policy and strategy development and coordination
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Strengthening integrated administrative systems (such as beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, payments)
Strengthening the social welfare workforce and direct outreach to families
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context) through technical assistance and/or funding

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1 By 2023, the Government of Lesotho has an improved child and gender-sensitive, shock-responsive social protection system.

description.narrative: During 2021 UNICEF has supported the Government of Lesotho to strengthen their child-sensitive and shock-responsive social protection system through strategy development, enrollment of urban households in NISSA, and supporting the vulnerable during the COVID - 19 pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/12/2021
